term.title: partition ratio

item.text: The ratio of the concentration of a substance in a single definite form, A, in the extract to its concentration in the same form in the other phase at equilibrium, e.g. for an aqueous/organic system:

notes.item: KD is sometimes called the distribution constant; this is a good synonym. The terms distribution coefficient, distribution ratio (in liquid-liquid distribution), partition constant (in liquid-liquid distribution) and extraction (in liquid-liquid distribution) constant should not be used as synonyms for partition (in liquid-liquid distribution) ratio.

The use of the inverse ratio (aqueous/organic) may be appropriate in certain cases, e.g. where the organic phase forms the feed but its use in such cases should be clearly specified. The ratio of the concentration in the denser phase to the less dense phase is not recommended as it can be ambiguous.
If the pure solvent and infinitely dilute feed are taken as the standard states, KD → KD° as the total concentration of dissolved materials decreases.

item.meaning: Partition ratio for component A (in chromatography)
